statement.p: Malcolm is conducting market research on the amount typically spent on the purchase of a first vehicle. Malcolm has determined that the average cost of a first vehicle is 7500, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 630.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected first-time vehicle purchase is more than 6970. (Round to 4 decimal places.)
b. The cost of the middle 80 of first-time vehicle purchases falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. If a random sample of 75 first-time vehicle purchasers is selected, what is the probability that the sample average amount spent is between 7470 and 7640? (Round to 4 decimal places.)
